quotes.quote: Easy street is a blind alley.
The language of the street is always strong.
The streets were dark with something more than night.
The street is full of humiliations to the proud.
In the street, the gaze of desire is furtive or menacing.
The roaring street is hung for miles With fierce electric fire.
By the streets of 'by and by,' one arrives at the house of 'never'.
The magic of the street is the mingling of the errand and the epiphany.
The streets are full of admirable craftsmen, but so few practical dreamers.
In the street, your mouth's a beak, big like a bird, and your future's bleak.
In the streets the children screamed. The lovers cried, and the poets dreamed
The streets of Vienna are paved with culture, the streets of other cities with asphalt.
On the streets, unrequited love and death go together almost as often as in Shakespeare.
What is a street? It is where the living weep, where the dead go off in silence to their peace.
A street that you have never visited is a book that you have never read! You never know what you are missing!
The street is the river of life of the city, the place where we come together, the pathway to the center.
An empty street sucks your fullness; a full street fills your emptiness!
Go into the street, and give one man a lecture on morality, and another a shilling, and see which will respect you most.
The streets of London have their map, but our passions are uncharted. What are you going to meet if you turn this corner?
In violent streets and broken homes, the cry of anguished souls is not for more laws but for more conscience and character.
Walking the streets of Charleston in the late afternoons of August was like walking through gauze or inhaling damaged silk.
The street is a room by agreement.
The street has its own use for things.
The streets of hell are paved with good intentions.
Every path, every street in the world is your walking meditation path.
A street in Constantinople is a picture which one ought to see once-not oftener.
A dead end street is a good place to turn around.
On the streets, hanging out with the fellows, there are things you learn that no book can teach you.
There are streets to enjoy, there are streets to wander aimlessly and also there are streets to contemplate!
A street full of shadows will teach you what life is much better than the street full of lights!
